page.title: 07THE YEW,FENSTANTON CHURCH
page.content: { The yew tree's}berries and leaves are very poisonous if you get them in your mouth and they are poisonous for animals too but not for birds. Because{the yew}is a birds home the birds feed on the berries from it. The bark from{the yew}is made into bows and arrows to fight with. Some yews are very old and some older than the churches.The{yew}guards the church because the vicar doesn't like animals coming in the church during a session so the{yew}keeps them away because the farm animals don't go near the church in case they get poisoned. The{yew}in our churchyard is like a den. The{yew}in our churchyard's trunk measures{185}centimetres around and the height of the tree is{8 metres.
